_header: Sad and solitary sitting mine alone
_description: ‘Think on thy end and thow sall never syn’ — five 8-line stanzas with this refrain

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Sad and solitare sittand myn alloneRemember of this warldis
                    vanite…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…Now send me Iesu for thy bitter passiounAne blissit end and
                    sauf my saull fra syn
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.250-2.
